possess and its value, authenticating the
suitability for the solar cell application. We also study the structural stability and mechanical stability

Ground-state geometries were calculated by minimizing stresses and Hellman-Feynman forces

The calculated Ga-Te distance is 2.69 Å, and Tl-Tl bond length is smaller than the separation between
Te and Tl atoms, which make up the GaTe
and short-circuit current of the solar cells are highly inﬂuenced by the band gap of the photoactive
ciency of an ideal solar cell is 32%for a material with
the optimal band gap of 1.4 eV [
]. Band gap calculation using electronic band structure provides a
promising opportunity to identify suitable PV materials. The band structure and site-projected density
calculated with HSE06 are shown in Figure
valence band maximum (VBM) is located at the Z-point and Z1-point. The ﬁrst conduction band
minimum (CBM) is located along M-P directions and the second CBMis located at Z-point. In two
erent experimental studies, it was reported that the band gap energy of TlGaTe
]. The reason for this deviation is not known. Our calculations show that TlGaTe
an indirect band gap of 1.109 eV, which is higher than the mBJ calculation (0.94 eV) [
good agreement with an experimentally veriﬁed band gap value of 1.2 eV [
exhibits a direct band gap of 1.129 eV at the Z-point and the di
indirect band gap is 20 meV. This phenomenon is veriﬁed further by a study on the optical properties
later in this article. The site-projected density of states shows that valence band maximum
(VBM) is mainly due to Tl-s state with little contribution of Te-p state, while conduction band maximum
(CBM) is mainly contributed by Ga-s state and Tl-d state in Figure

than the ﬁrst CBMalong M-P directions. Note that around Z-point, the VBMis somewhat ﬂatter than
the second CBM. Hence, it would appear that electrons are lighter than holes. The e
